abstract.li: geometric primitives of one and two dimensions;
geometry used in the construction of two-dimensional and three-dimensional shape representations;
association of a construction geometry to a geometric model or a construction from which it is derived.

inscope.li: geometric primitives of one and two dimensions; Points, lines, and planes are used to construct more complex geometry that represents the shape of products and features of products. Points, lines, and planes can represent the derived centres of ideal symmetric features of size found in product definitions. Points, curves, and surfaces can represent the derived centres of imperfect features of size measured on real workpieces.

geometry of dimension greater than three;
geometry for the representation of properties other than shape.
